AD.label: URI
AD.name: uri
AD.description: The URI of the MongoDB server of the form 'mongodb://host:[port]'. Separate URIs with a comma (CSV) for a replica set.

AD.label: Description
AD.name: description
AD.description: The description for Mongo instances created with these options. This is used in various places like logging.

AD.label: Connections Per Host
AD.name: connectionsPerHost
AD.description: The maximum number of connections allowed per host for this Mongo instance. Those connections will be kept in a pool when idle. Once the pool is exhausted, any operation requiring a connection will block waiting for an available connection. Default is 10.

AD.label: Blocked Threads Multiplier
AD.name: threadsAllowedToBlockForConnectionMultiplier
AD.description: This multiplier, multiplied with the connectionsPerHost setting, gives the maximum number of threads that may be waiting for a connection to become available from the pool. All further threads will get an exception right away. For example if connectionsPerHost is 10 and threadsAllowedToBlockForConnectionMultiplier is 5, then up to 50 threads can wait for a connection. Default is 5.

AD.label: Max Wait Time
AD.name: maxWaitTime
AD.description: The maximum wait time in ms that a thread may wait for a connection to become available. Default is 120,000.

AD.label: Connect Timeout
AD.name: connectTimeout
AD.description: The connection timeout in milliseconds. It is used solely when establishing a new connection Socket.connect(java.net.SocketAddress, int) Default is 0 and means no timeout.

AD.label: Socket Timeout
AD.name: socketTimeout
AD.description: The socket timeout in milliseconds It is used for I/O socket read and write operations Socket.setSoTimeout(int) Default is 0 and means no timeout.

AD.label: Socket Keep Alive
AD.name: socketKeepAlive
AD.description: This flag controls the socket keep alive feature that keeps a connection alive through firewalls Socket.setKeepAlive(boolean) Default is false.

AD.label: Auto Connect Retry
AD.name: autoConnectRetry
AD.description: If true, the driver will keep trying to connect to the same server in case that the socket cannot be established. There is maximum amount of time to keep retrying, which is 15s by default. This can be useful to avoid some exceptions being thrown when a server is down temporarily by blocking the operations. It also can be useful to smooth the transition to a new master (so that a new master is elected within the retry time). Note that when using this flag: - for a replica set, the driver will trying to connect to the old master for that time, instead of failing over to the new one right away - this does not prevent exception from being thrown in read/write operations on the socket, which must be handled by application Even if this flag is false, the driver already has mechanisms to automatically recreate broken connections and retry the read operations. Default is false.

AD.label: Max Auto Connect Retry Time
AD.name: maxAutoConnectRetryTime
AD.description: The maximum amount of time in MS to spend retrying to open connection to the same server. Default is 0, which means to use the default 15s if autoConnectRetry is on.

AD.label: Write Concern - safe
AD.name: safe
AD.description: If true the driver will use a WriteConcern of WriteConcern.SAFE for all operations. If w, wtimeout, fsync or j are specified, this setting is ignored. Default is false.

AD.label: Write Concern - w
AD.name: w
AD.description: The 'w' value of the global WriteConcern. Default is 0.

AD.label: Write Concern - wtimeout
AD.name: wtimeout
AD.description: The 'wtimeout' value of the global WriteConcern. Default is 0.

AD.label: Write Concern - fsync
AD.name: fsync
AD.description: The 'fsync' value of the global WriteConcern. Default is false.

AD.label: Write Concern - j
AD.name: j
AD.description: The 'j' value of the global WriteConcern. Default is false.
